qas.question: What is the micro connector designed for?

answers.text: to reduce the mechanical wear on the device

qas.question: What is the easier-to-replace cable designed for?

answers.text: to bear the mechanical wear of connection and disconnection

qas.question: What is the micro-plug rated for?

context: The micro plug design is rated for at least <a2_0>10,000 connect-disconnect cycles<a2_0/>, which is more than the mini plug design. The micro connector is also designed <a0_0>to reduce the mechanical wear on the device<a0_0/>; instead the easier-to-replace cable is designed <a1_0>to bear the mechanical wear of connection and disconnection<a1_0/>. The Universal Serial Bus Micro-USB Cables and Connectors Specification details the mechanical characteristics of micro-A plugs, micro-AB receptacles (which accept both micro-A and micro-B plugs), and micro-B plugs and receptacles, along with a standard-A receptacle to micro-A plug adapter.
